tw.gov.mohw.hisac.web

Class WebHOTPGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • tw.gov.mohw.hisac.web.WebHOTPGenerator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WebTOTPGenerator

    public class WebHOTPGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

    Generates HMAC-based one-time passwords (HOTP) as specified in RFC 4226.

    HmacOneTimePasswordGenerator instances are thread-safe and may be shared and re-used across multiple threads.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_PASSWORD_LENGTH
      The default length, in decimal digits, for one-time passwords.
      static java.lang.String HOTP_HMAC_ALGORITHM
      The HMAC algorithm specified by the HOTP standard.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebHOTPGenerator()
      Creates a new HMAC-based one-time password (HOTP) generator using a default password length (6 digits).
      WebHOTPGenerator(int codeLength)
      Creates a new HMAC-based one-time password (HOTP) generator using the given password length.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int generateOneTimePassword(java.security.Key key, long counter)
      Generates a one-time password using the given key and counter value.
      java.lang.String getAlgorithm()
      Returns the name of the HMAC algorithm used by this generator.
      int getCodeLength()
      Returns the length, in decimal digits, of passwords produced by this generator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebHOTPGenerator

        public WebHOTPGenerator()
                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Creates a new HMAC-based one-time password (HOTP) generator using a default password length (6 digits).
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the underlying JRE doesn't support the "HmacSHA1" algorithm, which should never happen except in cases of serious misconfiguration

      • WebHOTPGenerator

        public WebHOTPGenerator(int codeLength)
                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Creates a new HMAC-based one-time password (HOTP) generator using the given password length.
        Parameters:
        codeLength - the length, in decimal digits, of the one-time passwords to be generated; must be between 6 and 8, inclusive
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the underlying JRE doesn't support the "HmacSHA1" algorithm, which should never happen except in cases of serious misconfiguration

    • Method Detail

      • generateOneTimePassword

        public int generateOneTimePassword(java.security.Key key,
                                   long counter)
                            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Generates a one-time password using the given key and counter value.
        Parameters:
        key - a secret key to be used to generate the password
        counter - the counter value to be used to generate the password
        Returns:
        an integer representation of a one-time password; callers will need to format the password for display on their own
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given key is inappropriate for initializing the Mac for this generator

      • getAlgorithm

        public java.lang.String getAlgorithm()
        Returns the name of the HMAC algorithm used by this generator.
        Returns:
        the name of the HMAC algorithm used by this generator

      • getCodeLength

        public int getCodeLength()
        Returns the length, in decimal digits, of passwords produced by this generator.
        Returns:
        the length, in decimal digits, of passwords produced by this generator
